# How to make Zen Transparent (Credits to: [Zen-Nebula by JustAdumbPrsn](https://github.com/JustAdumbPrsn/Zen-Nebula))

## Requirements
1) [Mica For Everyone](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M7R1e_n8lhE)
2) [Transparency Effects Enabled in Windows settings](https://de4uth.org/TransparencyEffects.png)

## Create Chrome Folder

[How to create chrome folder.](https://de4uth.org/chromefolder.mp4)

## Applying Theme

- Download the `chrome.zip` file from the [latest release](https://github.com/JustAdumbPrsn/Nebula-A-Minimal-Theme-for-Zen-Browser/releases) <br>
- [How to put Theme in folder](https://de4uth.org/zentheme.mp4)

## Configs

1) Go to `about:config` in Zen.
2) Search for `browser.tabs.allow_transparent_browser`.
3) If visible, set it to `true`.

## Mica For Everyone Settings

1) If you have "Show Accent color on title bars and window borders" enabled in Windows 11 settings, please disable it for transparency to work. ![](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/73780892/433957748-e867a04e-a8ba-4795-bada-e22ca92fc657.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..6R1kjww2eHGlGINbxTRo9pLuHAPaeDcA8F5EXLR-IHo)
2) Make a Zen Process Rule (Don't forget to make the Z isn't a capital) ![](https://de4uth.org/processrule.png)
3) Set these rules for Zen ![](https://de4uth.org/micafordisocrd.png)
4) Make sure your Zen theme color contrast is set to 0 for it to look transparent.![](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/73780892/445041611-aff8398c-9457-4842-bb44-32932cb99e23.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..oAGS5YcMij0hXMuALmsBz9CEo0K9x_pBq9qBgCJjf0I)

## (Optional) Install Zen Internet
 - Install [Zen Internet Extension](https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/zen-internet/?utm_source=addons.mozilla.org&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=search) to get transparency on most websites.
